title: Ticket #7118: condor-annex-ec2 startup script needs better throttles
description:
The University of Manchester, via AWS, is reporting that they not infrequently don't see all of the instances which start as a result of their Spot Fleet request join the pool. The error they sent along was 

    An error occurred (RequestLimitExceeded) when calling the
    DescribeInstances operation (reached max retries: 4): Request limit
    exceeded.

Examination of condor_examples/condor-annex-ec2 and condor_examples/49ec2-instance.sh (the new and old scripts, respectively) reveal a typo in the handling of the Spot Fleet -specific throttle, and than the DescribeInstances throttle does not attempt to splay the requests any. We may also need to add an actual exponential back-off; question has been asked of the AWS contact.
remarks:
2019-Jul-02 14:38:23 by tlmiller:
Testing with an updated version of the HTCondor configuration -based script works; of 1000 spot instances, 987 joined the pool (although it did take 10-20 minutes). One of the missing 13 was aborted at launch by Amazon for aan unspecified reason; the other 12 had network connectivity issues that Amazon noticed but declined to fix.

I'll update the init.d / system.d script and test it shortly.

2019-Jul-02 17:18:31 by tlmiller:
Tested the init.d/system.d style; 996 of 1000 joined the pool, with 4 noted as having connectivity issues.

2019-Jul-27 18:49:48 by tlmiller:
HTCondor can not simultaneously run Docker jobs and have encrypted execute directories. The latter has been enabled for the default Annex AMI since the beginning, but we thought the former capability would be a good addition. Which is more important?

(If the answer is 'Docker', copy ami-0c76... to everywhere and reset the param table defaults (don't forget to include Europe on the master branch).)

See also #6690.

2019-Aug-02 14:21:28 by tlmiller:
The answer is 'Docker', but the named image still needs to turn off encrypted execute directories. :(
